title: (x) Time Magazine new serif text face - Proforma {Pieter}
content:
Time magazine has refreshed its design recently. New fonts were introduced. Any idea what's the serif one?  
knap

comments.content:
It’s Proforma by Petr van Blokland.  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Proforma/charset](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831123034/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Proforma/charset "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Proforma/charset")

Pieter

Thank you, Pieter.  
They got so close to The Economist now... (Time on left).  
knap

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831123034im_/http:/typophile.com/files/time_economist2_5246.jpg)

The Economist uses type by [Erik Spiekermann](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831123034/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20Spiekermann). Never thought of it as similar to Proforma, but the color does seem to compare.
